_header: London thou art of towns a per se
_description: To the City of London, attributed to William Dunbar — seven 8-line stanzas with refrain

OxfBal354.First Lines:
London thow art of townes a per seSoverayn of Cyties semlyest by
                    sight…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…A bove all mayres as master most worthyLondon þou art
                    the flowr of Cities all
OxfBal354.Attributed Title:
A treatice of London (p. 418); Explicit þe treatise of London made /
                    at [Marshaa?] table whan he was mayre (p. 419
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

BLCottVitAXVI.First Lines: London thou art of Townes A per seSouerayn of Cities semeliest in sight…
BLCottVitAXVI.Last Lines: …aboue all Maires as Maister moost worthyLondon thou art the fflour of Cities all

Guildhall3313.First Lines:
Londone thow art of Townys a per seSoverayn of Cytees semelyest In
                    sygth…
Guildhall3313.Last Lines:
…Above all Mayrys as Mastyr most worthyLondon thow art the
                    flower of Cytees all
Guildhall3313.Note:
Introduced in chronicle,‘In the Crystmesse weke ffolowyng the
                    Mayer had to dyner My lord Chanceler whom Accompanyed the fforenamyd Scottysh
                    Ambassadour wyth Many othyr honourable Men In tyme of which dyner a Scottysh
                    preyst Syttyng at oon of the syde tablys made thys Balade here vndyr
                    ffoluyng’ (f. 292v)
Guildhall3313.Attributed Title: A Scottes Balad (left margin, by scribe, f. 292v)
Guildhall3313.Editions:
Mackie,  Robert Laird. 
             King James IV of Scotland.
         Edinburgh: Oliver and Boyd, 1958; repr. 1976. 
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “‘London Thow Art the Flowre of Cytes All.’” 
             Review of English Studies
         13 (1938): 1-9: 8-9.

PierpontMA717.First Lines:
London thow arte of townes Chefe of dygnyteAnd saverent of all
                    Cytes semlyste in syght…
PierpontMA717.Last Lines:
…A bow all meyres ys moste wurthylondon þu art the flowre
                    of Cytes all
PierpontMA717.Note:
Removed from Caxton’s Cordiale, 1479, where probably originally
                    flyleaves.
PierpontMA717.Attributed Title:
A balad made at london when my lorde prince Arthur was wed by a skotte
                    hauyng muche money of dyuerse lordes for hys Indytyng (f. 1)
